{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3477309,"name":"","username":"Programming5130","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-09T22:09:02.126Z","cooked":"

Hello I’m a programmer on team 5130 and I’m currently stuck. We use the limelight 2 and just the other day we statically set the Ip on it and were following through the documentation provided by limelight, we had no problems and were trying to figure out how to read April tags. Then when I came in today suddenly the limelight finder could no longer find the limelight and I was unable to connect to it in any way, I’ve updated the image multiple times, reset the Ip on the limelight and our rio multiple times. I spent the whole day trying to figure it out with no luck. I’m relatively new to programming and any help would be amazing thank you!

What is your hardware setup? Radio? Network Switch? Direct Ethernet Cable or ?
Do you see activity on the Ethernet connector leds?

It seems like you are using your radio’s second port which might be caussing the issue.

Why you probably shouldn't use the second port on your OpenMesh OM5P Radio and embrace using an Ethernet Switch instead Technical
I noticed quite a few teams recently are running into an issue that I’m all too familiar with and I promised a few folks I would post this. I suspect this post will unintentionally ruffle someones feathers for some reason but I hope it doesn’t. I hope teams are able to read it and figure out some of the issues they have been having. The problem: So, you’re connecting your RoboRIO to your OpenMesh OM5P and you have a LimeLight or LemonLumen or PhotonCam or Jetson or Pi or whatever and you are…

I had it wired Incorrectly, I had a PoE cable running from the radio not to it, so once I changed that and just used a normal ethernet cable from Aux 1 to the limelight that solved the problem

Send a picture of the limelight configuration screen.
